content:
The panel discussion on "Building Trust in AI: Ethics, Transparency, and Accountability" is designed to be an interactive and engaging session, and audience participation is encouraged.

The session will be moderated by Dr. Rumman Chowdhury, who will lead the discussion among the panelists and ensure that the conversation stays focused and informative. The panelists will share their insights and perspectives on building trust in AI, and then the floor will be opened for audience Q&A.

**Audience Q&A:**

* The panel discussion will include a 15-20 minute Q&A session, where attendees can ask questions and engage with the panelists.
* The moderator will facilitate the Q&A session, ensuring that questions are addressed and that the discussion remains productive and respectful.
* Audience members can ask questions in person or submit them in advance through the conference app (more on that later).

**Interactive Elements:**

* To encourage audience participation, the session may include interactive elements, such as polls or live surveys, to gather feedback and opinions on specific topics related to AI ethics and accountability.
* The panelists may also use case studies or scenarios to illustrate key points and spark discussion among the audience.

The goal of the panel discussion is to create a dynamic and informative exchange of ideas, and the audience Q&A session is an essential part of that. By attending this session, you'll have the opportunity to engage with leading experts in AI ethics and accountability, ask questions, and contribute to the conversation.

Now, about the conference app... The AI Summit will have a dedicated mobile app that allows attendees to connect with each other, access session materials, and participate in Q&A sessions. You'll be able to submit questions in advance or during the session, and even upvote questions from other attendees to help the moderator prioritize the discussion. More details on the app will be shared closer to the event date.
